reviewText: This is a great set of 4 Westerns starring James Stewart, and at less than $10 is a real bargain to boot!! All 4 movies are well-written and plausible dramas, with good acting and fine production values as well. Another plus of these films is the top-notch actors they contain, including of course James Stewart in all 4, but also Maureen O'Hara, Arthur Kennedy, Julia Adams, Walter Brennan, Ruth Roman, John McIntire, Audie Murphy, and others. I'll want to see these movies repeatedly. None is excessively violent, but with a Western you expect some shoot-outs, right? "The Rare Breed" is the most off-beat story of the collection, with Maureen O'Hara and Juliet Mills coming from England to promote a certain breed of cattle in the United States, and as the story implies, there's especially little violence in this one. It's also helpful that all 4 films have optional English subtitles for persons hard-of-hearing, though none have subtitles in any other language.I can't say for sure whether these movies have been restored, but the picture and sound quality on all run from good to excellent, usually closer to excellent. For some reason "The Far Country" is a little grainier than the others. As for the debate among reviewers about the aspect ratios, the ones that are definitely wide-screen (2.35:1) on my TV are "Night Passage" and "The Rare Breed," which is as the box states. The box seems to be correct too that "Bend of the River" and "The Far Country" are in full screen at 1.33:1, although one or both may be at 1.66:1. In the 1950s, when these latter 2 films were made, it was common for films to be shot in 1.33:1 or 1.66:1, so one cannot expect all movies from that era to be widescreen.In sum, this is a great collection of Westerns, and the price is right!!
summary: Terrific Set of Westerns and Real Bargain
Title: 4 Movie Marathon: James Stewart Western Collection: (Bend of the River / The Far Country / Night Passage / The Rare Breed)

reviewText: I purchased this to get "Bend of the River", the only movie I saw when it first came out.  The others are equally fine representations of Stewart's Universal-International westerns from the early to mid-50s.  My personal favorite Stewart westerns are "Broken Arrow" (Fox) and "The Naked Spur" (M-G-M), from the same period, but not in this collection.
summary: Four Stewart westerns for a very reasonable price.
Title: 4 Movie Marathon: James Stewart Western Collection: (Bend of the River / The Far Country / Night Passage / The Rare Breed)

reviewText: Four westerns staring Jimmy Stewart,  the one man who can protect those in need. Each movie has a great supporting cast.  Bend in the river has Rock Hudson, Harry Morgan ( Col. Potter on MASH), Francis Bavier, ( Aunt Bea), Arthur Kennedy and Royal Dano.  It's full of western action  and great shoot outs.  Never mess with Jimmy Stewart.  In The Far Country we have Stewart teams up with Walter Brennan moving cattle to Alaska.  We also get great performances, from Harry Morgan, Jack Elam and Royal Dano.  Mr. Dano has one of those movies you never forget, He voiced Disney's Lincoln at the Lincoln exhibit. We get more shoot outs,  crooked law men and lots of horses. In the Rare Breed, Stewart helps heard cattle for a widow woman and her daughter. We also get great supporting performances from the great team of Ben Johnson and Harry Carey Jr. To round out the cast we have Maureen O'Hara, Jack Elam and Juliet Mills.  In Night Passage Stewart and Audie Murphy are at Odds while Jimmy protects Gold this time. Jack Elam turns up again.  I really enjoy These Jimmy Stewart Westerns, All these movies are Family friendly and have enjoyable story lines and great action.  I highly recommend this movie package.
Title: 4 Movie Marathon: James Stewart Western Collection: (Bend of the River / The Far Country / Night Passage / The Rare Breed)

reviewText: I just like James Stewart in any western.  His drawl makes me chuckle.  The man who shot Liberty Vallence was one of his best.

reviewText: We watched the fourth movie (Rare Breed) in this set last night.  It was great to watch a younger Brian Keith plus a Maureen O'Hara Plus Jimmy Stewart.  Al of the movies were enjoyable.  We had never seen them before.  The actors & actress kept their closes on except for a bath tub scene witch was modest & no cussing (what a relief!).  Didn't have to hit the mute button once!  No negatives.

This one doesn't waste your time, or your money with that nonsense. I got it at a great price too, on Amazon. Buy with confidence. This is a keeper.

reviewText: I always appreciated this actor, but this set made me realize that he's been in several westerns and easily stands beside John Wayne and Gary Cooper as a natural for the genre.  These are four sprawling and action packed westerns, but they also have full blooded dramatic quality.  If you haven't realized how well Stewart fits into westerns, get this set.
summary: James Steweart definitely was great in westerns

reviewText: While The Rare Breed was the least of the four films, it had its strong points (Brian Keith, for one), and was still very good.  All were quite re-watchable.The two disks were both single-sided (two movies on each), and very good quality.  A real winner.
Title: 4 Movie Marathon: James Stewart Western Collection: (Bend of the River / The Far Country / Night Passage / The Rare Breed)

reviewText: I like all of these Classic Westerns, but especially like Night Passage that stars Jimmy Stewart and the bonus of Audie Murphy.What a combination. Audie plays Stewarts' evil younger brother The Utica Kid, who repents at the end of the movie and starts fighting for the good guys. This film series is not Blue Ray but is very good as a standard DVD. These movies will not dissapoint as long as you like the circa 19th century after the Civil War and are satisfied with standard DVD quality.Hope this helps.Thank you.Blessings,Phil
summary: IF YOU LOVE JIMMY STEWART THESE ARE SOME GREAT CLASSICS...........
Title: 4 Movie Marathon: James Stewart Western Collection: (Bend of the River / The Far Country / Night Passage / The Rare Breed)

reviewText: This is an awesome set of some of James Stewart westerns; although, this doesn't have Shenandoah and Broken Arrow its still a great collection to have if you don't already have any of these films.All movies are in color and run about 1hr and 30min each. "Bend of the River" is the only one in Full screen format (Yes, the back says "Far Country" is in 1.33:1, but apparently they didn't change it for some reason) and "Night Passage" and "The Rare Breed" are both in Widescreen format (2.35:1) with "The Far Country" being 1.85:1 format, which is 16:9. There are two disks and with no double sided disks, so all movies are on one side. There isn't any features on these movies and there is only English for subtitles and language. Since Universal released this, the quality of this is just like buying the movies by themselves.These movies star of course James Stewart with: Rock Hudson, Audie Murphy, Arthur Kennedy, Julia Adams, Ruth Roman, Maureen O'Hara, Dan Duryea, Brian Keith, Jay C. Flippen, Henry (Harry) Morgan, Walter Brennan and others.I would definitely recommend this to anyone.By the way, I uploaded images of this DVD and the movies that were included by playing it on my computer and doing a printscreen of the movie.Also, I would recommend this two collections also released by Universal which I also loved:4 Movie Marathon: Classic Western Collection (Albuquerque / Whispering Smith / The Duel at Silver Creek / War Arrow)&4 Movie Marathon: Classic Western Collection (The Texas Rangers / Canyon Passage / Kansas Raiders / The Lawless Breed)
Title: 4 Movie Marathon: James Stewart Western Collection: (Bend of the River / The Far Country / Night Passage / The Rare Breed)

reviewText: Jimmy Stewart was one of the best actors of our time and all of the films he has played in is timeless classics I always enjoyed the characters he played especially the Honorable ones which went to great lengths to persevere and overcome all obstacles, unlike many of the worthless Hollywood films today without any "moral characters with great honor" such as the films he played in these western movies they are some of the timeless classics out there.
